moves.1. f4: I am totally fan of the Bird opening. 1.f4 try to control e5, ok it is a weak for the king but it is good for the king rook too after castle.
moves.2. Nf3: help the f4 pawn and control h4
moves.2... e6 3. e3: different possibility here, e3 is a good one (stonewall, iljin-genevsky, b3-Bb2)
moves.4. Ne5: the square e5 is weak (no black pawns can control it), so an early good place for the white knight. The black king lost freedom.
moves.5. Be2: probably not a good move, just I want to have the line h4-e8 and castle.
moves.5... g6 6. O-O: and now the rook is ok to go on the game
moves.6... Bd6 7. d4: like a stonewall, but the idea is to have the choice with d or f if the bishop take and continue development.
moves.7... g5: risky, open h5-e8, open the column f for the white rook, help bishop-queen development.
moves.8. fxg5 Qxg5 9. e4: attack queen and knight, take control of the king side.
moves.9... Qh4: here,  the queen can be trap.
moves.10. Bh5+: cut the link between the black knight and the black quenn
moves.10... Ke7 11. Bxh6 Nc6 12. Nxc6+: open e5 for the pawn to trap the queen
moves.12... bxc6 13. e5: more than attack the bishop, close f6 for the queen
moves.13... Bb4 14. c3: the idea is close the e1 square for the black queen, if the bishop b4 move again the black queen will be trap
moves.17. Qa4 Bb5 18. Qxa5 Kd7 19. Nd2: with the idea to reach the black king
moves.19... Bd3 20. Nb3: a possibility to a fork king bishop
